ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Principles of biochemistry, hemoglobin, amino acids, DNA, lipids, enzymes, different cycles, and how to use Chimera
I learned about in depth chemical processes in Biology, as well as connections between Organic Chemistry and Biological concepts.
I learned about principles of biochemistry and experimental methodologies relevant to the field.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was taught very well and the slides were very informative. Professor Collins is amazing and I genuinely enjoyed learning some of the information like how hemoglobins change states in order to pick up and drop oxygen, how CO poisoning works because these were genuine health related questions that makes you better understand how our body works. Such information really stick to your head.  Sometimes, however, the details of every section would get a little too gruesome and a little too specific for us to be able to grasp our head around. In the end, having learned ~60-70 slides per class and almost 200 slides by the end of the week, the class slowly started tiring us out mentally and stressing us. I thought the idea of Chimera, PLIP, and all the other softwares were very interesting and eye opening, but also a little stressful. Having a step by step guidance at the beginning of the projects to at least introduce us into how Chimera works and an example of what is being asked/what is a great answer would be great.

The information was very clear and well taught! I think the pacing toward the end of the course became quite hectic for students, and that the workload of projects could be better paced in the middle area of the course to accommodate this.
I really liked this class. Taking it over the summer was a great choice. I feel like I learned a lot of material in a short time without it being stressful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes just because the professor is such a great person (he is like the friendliest teddy bear in human form) and I can tell how enthusiastic he is.
Definitely take this class over the summer if Professor Collins is teaching. He's a very clear instructor, and he's always willing to answer questions.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: This course will certainly help me be prepared for MCAT!
The class provides a good foundation for further pursuits in biochemistry. With the research-style projects, I think it's helpful for anyone going into research or medicine.
